--- title: Lake Nebagamon Ice description: An analysis of ice-in and out data for Lake Nebagamon, WI since 1943. author: Derek H. Ogle date: 2/4/2023 image: Ice.jpg categories: - Climate/Weather - Limnology - Vis knitr: opts_chunk: fig.width: 6 fig.height: 4 format: html: df-print: kable --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Ice.jpg){fig-align='center' width=67%} ::: ::: :::{.callout-warning icon=false} # Summary - [Lake Nebagamon](https://dnr.wi.gov/lakes/lakepages/LakeDetail.aspx?wbic=2865000), in Douglas County, is 986 acres with a maximum depth of 56 feet. - Ice-in and out dates recorded from 1943 to 2023. - The average ice-in date is Nov 29 and the average ice-out date is Apr 19 (see @fig-inouthist). - The range for both ice-in (Nov 7 to Dec 26) and ice-out (Mar 13 to May 14) dates is considerable, at approximately six to eight weeks (see @fig-inouthist). - There are *weak* indications for a slightly later ice-in date and, *possibly*, a slightly earlier ice-out date in the last two decades (see @fig-inout). - Since 1943 the average days of ice coverage was 141 days, though the range was considerable from 105 to 174 days (see @fig-durhist). - There is an indication that the length of ice duration has declined, on average, by a little over a week in the last two decades (see @fig-dur). - Eight of the ten shortest ice duration seasons have occurred since 2000 (see @tbl-durShort), whereas only one of the ten longest ice duration seasons have occurred in that same time period (see @tbl-durLong). - Data were provided by Gary Hagstrom who received it from XXX. The original data acknowledged J Arthur, G DeBrunye, W Kiefer, A Mack, M Laskkowski, J Snydle. :::   ## Ice In and Out Dates ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Lake Nebagamon ice in and out dates, 1943-2023.](index_files/figure-html/fig-inouthist-1.png){#fig-inouthist fig-align='center' width=768} ::: ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Lake Nebagamon ice in and out dates by year.](index_files/figure-html/fig-inout-1.png){#fig-inout fig-align='center' width=576} ::: ::: ## Ice Duration ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Lake Nebagamon ice durations, 1943-2023.](index_files/figure-html/fig-durhist-1.png){#fig-durhist fig-align='center' width=480} ::: ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![Lake Nebagamon ice duration by year.](index_files/figure-html/fig-dur-1.png){#fig-dur fig-align='center' width=576} ::: :::   ::: {#tbl-durShort .cell layout-align="center" tbl-cap='Winter seasons with the 10 **shortest** ice durations, 1943-2023.'} ::: {.cell-output-display}
|Season |In |Out | Duration| |:---------|:------|:------|--------:| |2023-2024 |Nov 28 |Mar 12 | 105| |2011-2012 |Dec 2 |Mar 21 | 110| |2015-2016 |Dec 26 |Apr 14 | 110| |1998-1999 |Dec 21 |Apr 13 | 113| |2009-2010 |Dec 6 |Mar 31 | 115| |2016-2017 |Dec 10 |Apr 4 | 115| |2004-2005 |Dec 14 |Apr 11 | 118| |2001-2002 |Dec 20 |Apr 18 | 119| |2007-2008 |Dec 1 |Mar 29 | 119| |1944-1945 |Dec 1 |Mar 31 | 120| |1984-1985 |Dec 19 |Apr 18 | 120|
::: :::   ::: {#tbl-durLong .cell layout-align="center" tbl-cap='Winter seasons with the 10 **longest** ice durations, 1943-2023.'} ::: {.cell-output-display}
|Season |In |Out | Duration| |:---------|:------|:------|--------:| |1995-1996 |Nov 13 |May 5 | 174| |1991-1992 |Nov 7 |Apr 26 | 171| |1943-1944 |Nov 13 |May 1 | 170| |1949-1950 |Nov 25 |May 14 | 170| |1955-1956 |Nov 19 |Apr 28 | 161| |1964-1965 |Nov 20 |Apr 30 | 161| |2013-2014 |Nov 26 |May 6 | 161| |1946-1947 |Nov 23 |May 2 | 160| |1959-1960 |Nov 14 |Apr 20 | 158| |1978-1979 |Nov 20 |Apr 27 | 158|
::: :::
